properties.name: Species

properties.description: The number of bi-molecular reactions in the gas phase chemistry scheme.

properties.description: The number of ter-molecular reactions in the gas phase chemistry scheme.

properties.name: Number Of Steady State Species
properties.description: The number of gas phase species for which the concentration is updated in the chemical solver assuming photochemical steady state

properties.name: Wet Deposition
properties.description: Is wet deposition included? Wet deposition describes the moist processes by which gaseous species deposit themselves on solid surfaces thus decreasing their concentration in the air.

properties.name: Wet Oxidation
properties.description: Is wet oxidation included? Oxidation describes the loss of electrons or an increase in oxidation state by a molecule

properties.name: Method
properties.description: Photolysis scheme

subTopics.description: Photolysis scheme
subTopics.name: Photolysis

values: Clear-sky photolysis frequencies are calculated using a multivariate interpolation table derived from the Tropospheric Ultraviolet-Visible radiation model (Madronich and Flocke, 1998), with an adjustment applied for the effects of large-scale clouds, as described by Brasseur et al. (1998).

properties.description: Overview of atmospheric chemistry photo chemistry in atmoschem model.

properties.description: The number of reactions in the photo-chemistry scheme.
